output.dependency: The values in the first column represent the names of sources reporting flight information, while the third column indicates a specific flight identifier. The presence of a specific flight identifier across different sources suggests a dependency where the flight information reported by the source corresponds to that particular flight.

The values in the third column represent scheduled departure times of the flight, and the fourth column represents the actual departure times. The departure times suggest a direct dependency where each scheduled time is expected to match or relate closely to the actual departure time.

The first column possibly represents an identifier for each record, while the second column provides the name of the source reporting the flight information. This indicates a dependency where each identifier may correspond to a unique source.
The values in the fourth column denote the actual departure times while the fifth column indicates the arrival times. The arrival times are dependent on when the flight departed.
The fifth column represents the scheduled arrival times, while the sixth column shows actual arrival times. Each set of actual arrival times depends upon the corresponding scheduled arrival times.

The third column denotes a specific flight number involving certain departure and arrival procedures, while the fourth column indicates its scheduled departure timeâ€”implying that the flight number has an inherent relation to the scheduled departure.
